section.title: Overview
section.p: This section describes the issues faced by NCC tools. For more information on NCC tools, see the NCC tools appendix of this guide.

sectiondiv.p: This procedure describes the options provided by the db-list tool that can be helpful in case the database dump taken from a system having a larger data size provisioned. For example, millions of devices with all associated charging data.
The following snippet is a sample logging by the db-list tool in case the heap size (memory available to the tool) is less in comparison to the size of records.

sectiondiv.p: Follow either of the given options:

li.p: If free memory is available on the node running the db-list tool, then the option r can be used to set the heap size. For example, -r 4096
This changes the heap size from its default value of 2 GB to a new value of 4 GB.
Note: Nokia recommends not to increase the heap size beyond half of the total memory of the node running the db-list tool.
Another option is to reduce the worker queue capacity from the existing value of 100k records. The option q can be used, for example -q 70000.
This leads to the lesser memory requirement by the tool.
If the CPU usage is going high, then the value of t, which refer to the number of threads should be reduced.
